activationEvents.description: Activation events for the VS Code extension.

defaultSnippets.label: onWebviewPanel
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emmited when a webview is loaded of a certain viewType

defaultSnippets.label: onLanguage
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a file that resolves to the specified language gets opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onCommand
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever the specified command gets invoked.

defaultSnippets.label: onDebug
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a user is about to start debugging or about to setup debug configurations.

defaultSnippets.label: onDebugInitialConfigurations
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a "launch.json" needs to be created (and all provideDebugConfigurations methods need to be called).

defaultSnippets.label: onDebugDynamicConfigurations
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a list of all debug configurations needs to be created (and all provideDebugConfigurations methods for the "dynamic" scope need to be called).

defaultSnippets.label: onDebugResolve
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a debug session with the specific type is about to be launched (and a corresponding resolveDebugConfiguration method needs to be called).

defaultSnippets.label: onDebugAdapterProtocolTracker
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a debug session with the specific type is about to be launched and a debug protocol tracker might be needed.

defaultSnippets.label: workspaceContains
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a folder is opened that contains at least a file matching the specified glob pattern.

defaultSnippets.label: onStartupFinished
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted after the start-up finished (after all `*` activated extensions have finished activating).

defaultSnippets.label: onTaskType
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever tasks of a certain type need to be listed or resolved.

defaultSnippets.label: onFileSystem
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a file or folder is accessed with the given scheme.

defaultSnippets.label: onEditSession
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever an edit session is accessed with the given scheme.

defaultSnippets.label: onSearch
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a search is started in the folder with the given scheme.

defaultSnippets.label: onView
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever the specified view is expanded.

defaultSnippets.label: onUri
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a system-wide Uri directed towards this extension is open.

defaultSnippets.label: onOpenExternalUri
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a external uri (such as an http or https link) is being opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onCustomEditor
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever the specified custom editor becomes visible.

defaultSnippets.label: onNotebook
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever the specified notebook document is opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onAuthenticationRequest
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever sessions are requested from the specified authentication provider.

defaultSnippets.label: onRenderer
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenever a notebook output renderer is used.

defaultSnippets.label: onTerminalProfile
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when a specific terminal profile is launched.

defaultSnippets.label: onTerminalQuickFixRequest
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when a command matches the selector associated with this ID

defaultSnippets.label: onWalkthrough
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when a specified walkthrough is opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onIssueReporterOpened
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when the issue reporter is opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onChatParticipant
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when the specified chat participant is invoked.

defaultSnippets.label: onLanguageModelChatProvider
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when a chat model provider for the given vendor is requested.

defaultSnippets.label: onLanguageModelTool
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when the specified language model tool is invoked.

defaultSnippets.label: onTerminal
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when a terminal of the given shell type is opened.

defaultSnippets.label: onTerminalCompletionsRequested
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when terminal completions are requested.

defaultSnippets.label: onTerminalShellIntegration
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted when terminal shell integration is activated for the given shell type.

defaultSnippets.label: onMcpCollection
defaultSnippets.description: An activation event emitted whenver a tool from the MCP server is requested.

An activation event emitted on VS Code startup. To ensure a great end user experience, please use this activation event in your extension only when no other activation events combination works in your use-case.

api.markdownDescription: Describe the API provided by this extension. For more details visit: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/advanced-topics/remote-extensions#handling-dependencies-with-remote-extensions
enumDescriptions: Give up entirely the ability to export any APIs. This allows other extensions that depend on this extension to run in a separate extension host process or in a remote machine.

badges.description: Array of badges to display in the sidebar of the Marketplace's extension page.

capabilities.description: Declare the set of supported capabilities by the extension.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Declares how the extension should be handled in untrusted workspaces.

description.markdownDescription: A description of how workspace trust affects the extensions behavior and why it is needed. This only applies when `supported` is not `true`.

restrictedConfigurations.description: A list of configuration keys contributed by the extension that should not use workspace values in untrusted workspaces.

supported.markdownDescription: Declares the level of support for untrusted workspaces by the extension.
enumDescriptions: The extension will not be enabled in untrusted workspaces.
The extension will be enabled in untrusted workspaces with some functionality disabled.
The extension will be enabled in untrusted workspaces with all functionality enabled.

virtualWorkspaces.description: Declares whether the extension should be enabled in virtual workspaces. A virtual workspace is a workspace which is not backed by any on-disk resources. When false, this extension will be automatically disabled in virtual workspaces. Default is true.

description.markdownDescription: A description of how virtual workspaces affects the extensions behavior and why it is needed. This only applies when `supported` is not `true`.

supported.markdownDescription: Declares the level of support for virtual workspaces by the extension.
enumDescriptions: The extension will not be enabled in virtual workspaces.
The extension will be enabled in virtual workspaces with some functionality disabled.
The extension will be enabled in virtual workspaces with all functionality enabled.

categories.description: The categories used by the VS Code gallery to categorize the extension.

contributes.description: All contributions of the VS Code extension represented by this package.

items.description: A list of globs that match the authorization servers that this provider supports.

authorizationServerGlobs.description: A list of globs that match the authorization servers that this provider supports.

id.description: The id of the authentication provider.

label.description: The human readable name of the authentication provider.

when.description: Condition which must be true to enable breakpoints in this language. Consider matching this to the debugger when clause as appropriate.

chatOutputRenderers.description: Contributes a renderer for specific MIME types in chat outputs

mimeTypes.description: MIME types that this renderer can handle

commands.markdownDescription: Commands available for this chat participant, which the user can invoke with a `/`.

disambiguation.description: Metadata to help with automatically routing user questions to this chat command.

description.description: A detailed description of the kinds of questions that are suitable for this chat command.

examples.description: A list of representative example questions that are suitable for this chat command.

sampleRequest.description: When the user clicks this command in `/help`, this text will be submitted to the participant.

description.description: A description of this chat participant, shown in the UI.

disambiguation.description: Metadata to help with automatically routing user questions to this chat participant.

description.description: A detailed description of the kinds of questions that are suitable for this chat participant.

examples.description: A list of representative example questions that are suitable for this chat participant.

fullName.markdownDescription: The full name of this chat participant, which is shown as the label for responses coming from this participant. If not provided, `name` is used.

id.description: A unique id for this chat participant.

name.description: User-facing name for this chat participant. The user will use '@' with this name to invoke the participant. Name must not contain whitespace.

sampleRequest.description: When the user clicks this participant in `/help`, this text will be submitted to the participant.

when.description: A condition which must be true to enable this participant.

chatSessions.description: Contributes chat session integrations to the chat widget.

capabilities.description: Optional capabilities for this chat session.

supportsFileAttachments.description: Whether this chat session supports attaching files or file references.

supportsToolAttachments.description: Whether this chat session supports attaching tools or tool references.

commands.markdownDescription: Commands available for this chat session, which the user can invoke with a `/`.

description.description: Description of the chat session for use in menus and tooltips.

displayName.description: A longer name for this item which is used for display in menus.

name.description: Name shown in the chat widget. (eg: @agent)

type.description: Unique identifier for the type of chat session.

chatViewsWelcome.description: Contributes a welcome message to a chat view

content.description: The content of the welcome message. The first command link will be rendered as a button.

icon.description: The icon for the welcome message.

title.description: The title of the welcome message.

when.description: Condition when the welcome message is shown.

dark.description: The default color for dark themes. Either a color value in hex (#RRGGBB[AA]) or the identifier of a themable color which provides the default.

highContrast.description: The default color for high contrast dark themes. Either a color value in hex (#RRGGBB[AA]) or the identifier of a themable color which provides the default. If not provided, the `dark` color is used as default for high contrast dark themes.

highContrastLight.description: The default color for high contrast light themes. Either a color value in hex (#RRGGBB[AA]) or the identifier of a themable color which provides the default. If not provided, the `light` color is used as default for high contrast light themes.

light.description: The default color for light themes. Either a color value in hex (#RRGGBB[AA]) or the identifier of a themable color which provides the default.

description.description: The description of the themable color

id.description: The identifier of the themable color
id.patternErrorMessage: Identifiers must only contain letters, digits and dots and can not start with a dot

commands.description: Contributes commands to the command palette.

continueEditSession.description: Contributes options for continuing the current edit session in a different environment

command.description: Identifier of the command to execute. The command must be declared in the 'commands'-section and return a URI representing a different environment where the current edit session can be continued.

description.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to the option's documentation page.

group.description: Group into which this item belongs.

qualifiedName.description: A fully qualified name for this item which is used for display in menus.

remoteGroup.description: Group into which this item belongs in the remote indicator.

displayName.description: Human readable name of the custom editor. This is displayed to users when selecting which editor to use.

selector.description: Set of globs that the custom editor is enabled for.

filenamePattern.description: Glob that the custom editor is enabled for.

viewType.markdownDescription: Identifier for the custom editor. This must be unique across all custom editors, so we recommend including your extension id as part of `viewType`. The `viewType` is used when registering custom editors with `vscode.registerCustomEditorProvider` and in the `onCustomEditor:${id}` [activation event](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/activation-events).

args.description: Optional arguments to pass to the adapter.

configurationSnippets.description: Snippets for adding new configurations in 'launch.json'.

deprecated.description: Optional message to mark this debug type as being deprecated.

hiddenWhen.description: When this condition is true, this debugger type is hidden from the debugger list, but is still enabled.

label.description: Display name for this debug adapter.

languages.description: List of languages for which the debug extension could be considered the "default debugger".

program.description: Path to the debug adapter program. Path is either absolute or relative to the extension folder.

runtime.description: Optional runtime in case the program attribute is not an executable but requires a runtime.

strings.description: UI strings contributed by this debug adapter.

unverifiedBreakpoints.description: When there are unverified breakpoints in a language supported by this debug adapter, this message will appear on the breakpoint hover and in the breakpoints view. Markdown and command links are supported.

type.description: Unique identifier for this debug adapter.

variables.description: Mapping from interactive variables (e.g. ${action.pickProcess}) in `launch.json` to a command.

when.description: Condition which must be true to enable this type of debugger. Consider using 'shellExecutionSupported', 'virtualWorkspace', 'resourceScheme' or an extension-defined context key as appropriate for this.

id.description: Name of the debug visualizer

when.description: Condition when the debug visualizer is applicable

balancedBracketScopes.description: Defines which scope names contain balanced brackets.

embeddedLanguages.description: A map of scope name to language id if this grammar contains embedded languages.

injectTo.description: List of language scope names to which this grammar is injected to.

language.description: Language identifier for which this syntax is contributed to.

path.description: Path of the tmLanguage file. The path is relative to the extension folder and typically starts with './syntaxes/'.

scopeName.description: Textmate scope name used by the tmLanguage file.

tokenTypes.description: A map of scope name to token types.

unbalancedBracketScopes.description: Defines which scope names do not contain balanced brackets.

propertyNames.description: The identifier of the themable icon
propertyNames.patternErrorMessage: Identifiers can only contain letters, digits and minuses and need to consist of at least two segments in the form `component-iconname`.

description.description: The description of the themable icon

fontPath.description: The path of the icon font that defines the icon.

fontCharacter.description: The character for the icon in the icon font.

default.description: The default of the icon. Either a reference to an existing ThemeIcon or an icon in an icon font.

id.description: Id of the file icon theme as used in the user settings.

label.description: Label of the file icon theme as shown in the UI.

path.description: Path of the file icon theme definition file. The path is relative to the extension folder and is typically './fileicons/awesome-icon-theme.json'.

fileMatch.description: The file pattern (or an array of patterns) to match, for example "package.json" or "*.launch". Exclusion patterns start with '!'

url.description: A schema URL ('http:', 'https:') or relative path to the extension folder ('./').

languageModelChatProviders.description: Contribute language model chat providers of a specific vendor.

languageModelTools.description: Contributes a tool that can be invoked by a language model in a chat session, or from a standalone command. Registered tools can be used by all extensions.

canBeReferencedInPrompt.markdownDescription: If true, this tool shows up as an attachment that the user can add manually to their request. Chat participants will receive the tool in `ChatRequest#toolReferences`.

displayName.description: A human-readable name for this tool that may be used to describe it in the UI.

icon.markdownDescription: An icon that represents this tool. Either a file path, an object with file paths for dark and light themes, or a theme icon reference, like "\$(zap)"

inputSchema.description: A JSON schema for the input this tool accepts. The input must be an object at the top level. A particular language model may not support all JSON schema features. See the documentation for the language model family you are using for more information.

modelDescription.description: A description of this tool that may be used by a language model to select it.

name.description: A unique name for this tool. This name must be a globally unique identifier, and is also used as a name when presenting this tool to a language model.

tags.description: A set of tags that roughly describe the tool's capabilities. A tool user may use these to filter the set of tools to just ones that are relevant for the task at hand, or they may want to pick a tag that can be used to identify just the tools contributed by this extension.

toolReferenceName.markdownDescription: If `canBeReferencedInPrompt` is enabled for this tool, the user may use '#' with this name to invoke the tool in a query. Otherwise, the name is not required. Name must not contain whitespace.

userDescription.description: A description of this tool that may be shown to the user.

when.markdownDescription: Condition which must be true for this tool to be enabled. Note that a tool may still be invoked by another extension even when its `when` condition is false.

languageModelToolSets.description: Contributes a set of language model tools that can be used together.

description.description: A description of this tool set.

icon.markdownDescription: An icon that represents this tool set, like `$(zap)`

name.description: A name for this tool set. Used as reference and should not contain whitespace.

tools.markdownDescription: A list of tools or tool sets to include in this tool set. Cannot be empty and must reference tools by their `toolReferenceName`.

configuration.description: A relative path to a file containing configuration options for the language.

extensions.description: File extensions associated to the language.

filenamePatterns.description: File name glob patterns associated to the language.

filenames.description: File names associated to the language.

firstLine.description: A regular expression matching the first line of a file of the language.

icon.description: A icon to use as file icon, if no icon theme provides one for the language.

id.description: ID of the language.

mimetypes.description: Mime types associated to the language.

languageName.description: Name of the language in English.

localizedLanguageName.description: Name of the language in contributed language.

translations.description: List of translations associated to the language.

id.description: Id of VS Code or Extension for which this translation is contributed to. Id of VS Code is always `vscode` and of extension should be in format `publisherId.extensionName`.
id.patternErrorMessage: Id should be `vscode` or in format `publisherId.extensionName` for translating VS code or an extension respectively.

path.description: A relative path to a file containing translations for the language.

entrypoint.description: Path to file loaded in the webview.

localResourceRoots.description: Paths to additional resources that should be allowed in the webview.

entrypoint.description: File to load in the webview to render the extension.

mimeTypes.description: Set of globs that the notebook is for.

entrypoint.description: File to load in the webview to render the extension.

extends.description: Existing renderer that this one extends.

path.description: File to load in the webview to render the extension.

dependencies.markdownDescription: List of kernel dependencies the renderer requires. If any of the dependencies are present in the `NotebookKernel.preloads`, the renderer can be used.

displayName.description: Human readable name of the notebook output renderer.

id.description: Unique identifier of the notebook output renderer.

optionalDependencies.markdownDescription: List of soft kernel dependencies the renderer can make use of. If any of the dependencies are present in the `NotebookKernel.preloads`, the renderer will be preferred over renderers that don't interact with the kernel.

enumDescriptions: Messaging is required. The renderer will only be used when it's part of an extension that can be run in an extension host.
The renderer does not require messaging.
The renderer is better with messaging available, but it's not requried.
requiresMessaging.description: Defines how and if the renderer needs to communicate with an extension host, via `createRendererMessaging`. Renderers with stronger messaging requirements may not work in all environments.

displayName.description: Human readable name of the notebook.

selector.description: Set of globs that the notebook is for.

excludeFileNamePattern.description: Glob that the notebook is disabled for.

filenamePattern.description: Glob that the notebook is enabled for.

applyTo.description: Controls if a problem reported on a text document is applied only to open, closed or all documents.

background.description: Patterns to track the begin and end of a matcher active on a background task.

activeOnStart.description: If set to true the background monitor starts in active mode. This is the same as outputting a line that matches beginsPattern when the task starts.

beginsPattern.description: If matched in the output the start of a background task is signaled.

endsPattern.description: If matched in the output the end of a background task is signaled.

base.description: The name of a base problem matcher to use.

fileLocation.description: Defines how file names reported in a problem pattern should be interpreted. A relative fileLocation may be an array, where the second element of the array is the path of the relative file location. The search fileLocation mode, performs a deep (and, possibly, heavy) file system search within the directories specified by the include/exclude properties of the second element (or the current workspace directory if not specified).

label.description: A human readable label of the problem matcher.

name.description: The name of the problem matcher used to refer to it.

owner.description: The owner of the problem inside Code. Can be omitted if base is specified. Defaults to 'external' if omitted and base is not specified.

anyOf.description: The name of a contributed or predefined pattern

pattern.description: A problem pattern or the name of a contributed or predefined problem pattern. Can be omitted if base is specified.

severity.description: The default severity for captures problems. Is used if the pattern doesn't define a match group for severity.

source.description: A human-readable string describing the source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

watching.deprecationMessage: The watching property is deprecated. Use background instead.
watching.description: Patterns to track the begin and end of a watching matcher.

activeOnStart.description: If set to true the watcher starts in active mode. This is the same as outputting a line that matches beginsPattern when the task starts.

beginsPattern.description: If matched in the output the start of a watching task is signaled.

endsPattern.description: If matched in the output the end of a watching task is signaled.

name.description: The name of the problem pattern.
The name of the problem multi line problem pattern.

id.description: Id of the product icon theme as used in the user settings.

label.description: Label of the product icon theme as shown in the UI.

path.description: Path of the product icon theme definition file. The path is relative to the extension folder and is typically './producticons/awesome-product-icon-theme.json'.

remoteCodingAgents.description: Contributes remote coding agent integrations to the chat widget.

command.description: Identifier of the command to execute. The command must be declared in the "commands" section.

description.description: Description of the remote agent for use in menus and tooltips.

displayName.description: A user-friendly name for this item which is used for display in menus.

followUpRegex.description: The last occurrence of pattern in an existing chat conversation is sent to the contributing extension to facilitate follow-up responses.

id.description: A unique identifier for this item.

documentation.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to your project's documentation page

feedback.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to your project's feedback reporter

getStarted.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to your project's Getting Started page, or a walkthrough ID contributed by your project's extension

id.description: The ID of a Get Started walkthrough to open.

issues.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to your project's issues list

reportIssue.description: The url, or a command that returns the url, to your project's issue reporter

authority.description: URI authority on which to match the formatter on. Simple glob patterns are supported.

formatting.description: Rules for formatting uri resource labels.

label.description: Label rules to display. For example: myLabel:/${path}. ${path}, ${scheme}, ${authority} and ${authoritySuffix} are supported as variables.

separator.description: Separator to be used in the uri label display. '/' or '' as an example.

stripPathStartingSeparator.description: Controls whether `${path}` substitutions should have starting separator characters stripped.

tildify.description: Controls if the start of the uri label should be tildified when possible.

workspaceSuffix.description: Suffix appended to the workspace label.

scheme.description: URI scheme on which to match the formatter on. For example "file". Simple glob patterns are supported.

description.description: The description of the semantic token modifier

id.description: The identifier of the semantic token modifier
id.patternErrorMessage: Identifiers should be in the form letterOrDigit[_-letterOrDigit]*

language.description: Lists the languge for which the defaults are.

scopes.description: Maps a semantic token (described by semantic token selector) to one or more textMate scopes used to represent that token.

description.description: The description of the semantic token type

id.description: The identifier of the semantic token type
id.patternErrorMessage: Identifiers should be in the form letterOrDigit[_-letterOrDigit]*

superType.description: The super type of the semantic token type
superType.patternErrorMessage: Super types should be in the form letterOrDigit[_-letterOrDigit]*

language.description: Language identifier for which this snippet is contributed to.

path.description: Path of the snippets file. The path is relative to the extension folder and typically starts with './snippets/'.

description.description: A description of this Speech Provider, shown in the UI.

name.description: Unique name for this Speech Provider.

statusBarItems.description: Contributes items to the status bar.

submenus.description: Contributes submenu items to the editor

icon.description: (Optional) Icon which is used to represent the submenu in the UI. Either a file path, an object with file paths for dark and light themes, or a theme icon references, like "\$(zap)"

id.description: Identifier of the menu to display as a submenu.

label.description: The label of the menu item which leads to this submenu.

properties.description: Additional properties of the task type

type.description: The actual task type. Please note that types starting with a '$' are reserved for internal usage.

when.markdownDescription: Condition which must be true to enable this type of task. Consider using `shellExecutionSupported`, `processExecutionSupported`, and `customExecutionSupported` as appropriate for this task definition. See the [API documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/extension-guides/task-provider#when-clause) for more information.

profiles.description: Defines additional terminal profiles that the user can create.

icon.description: A codicon, URI, or light and dark URIs to associate with this terminal type.

id.description: The ID of the terminal profile provider.

commandExitResult.description: The command exit result to match on
enumDescriptions: The command exited with a non-zero exit code.
The command exited with an exit code of zero.

id.description: The ID of the quick fix provider

kind.description: The kind of the resulting quick fix. This changes how the quick fix is presented. Defaults to `"fix"`.
enumDescriptions: A high confidence quick fix.
An explanation of the problem.

outputMatcher.markdownDescription:
A regular expression or string to match a single line of the output against, which provides groups to be referenced in terminalCommand and uri.

For example:

 `lineMatcher: /git push --set-upstream origin (?<branchName>[^s]+)/;`

`terminalCommand: 'git push --set-upstream origin ${group:branchName}';`

anchor.description: Where the search should begin in the buffer

length.description: The number of rows to match against, this should be as small as possible for performance reasons

offset.description: The number of lines vertically from the anchor in the buffer to start matching against

id.description: Id of the color theme as used in the user settings.

label.description: Label of the color theme as shown in the UI.

path.description: Path of the tmTheme file. The path is relative to the extension folder and is typically './colorthemes/awesome-color-theme.json'.

uiTheme.description: Base theme defining the colors around the editor: 'vs' is the light color theme, 'vs-dark' is the dark color theme. 'hc-black' is the dark high contrast theme, 'hc-light' is the light high contrast theme.

debug.description: Contributes views to Debug container in the Activity bar

explorer.description: Contributes views to Explorer container in the Activity bar

remote.description: Contributes views to Remote container in the Activity bar. To contribute to this container, enableProposedApi needs to be turned on

id.description: Identifier of the view. This should be unique across all views. It is recommended to include your extension id as part of the view id. Use this to register a data provider through `vscode.window.registerTreeDataProviderForView` API. Also to trigger activating your extension by registering `onView:${id}` event to `activationEvents`.

remoteName.description: The name of the remote type associated with this view

scm.description: Contributes views to SCM container in the Activity bar

test.description: Contributes views to Test container in the Activity bar

additionalProperties.description: Contributes views to contributed views container

viewsContainers.description: Contributes views containers to the editor

activitybar.description: Contribute views containers to Activity Bar

secondarySidebar.description: Contribute views containers to Secondary Side Bar

viewsWelcome.description: Contributed views welcome content. Welcome content will be rendered in tree based views whenever they have no meaningful content to display, ie. the File Explorer when no folder is open. Such content is useful as in-product documentation to drive users to use certain features before they are available. A good example would be a `Clone Repository` button in the File Explorer welcome view.

items.description: Contributed welcome content for a specific view.

contents.description: Welcome content to be displayed. The format of the contents is a subset of Markdown, with support for links only.

enablement.description: Condition when the welcome content buttons and command links should be enabled.

group.description: Group to which this welcome content belongs. Proposed API.

anyOf.description: Target view identifier for this welcome content. Only tree based views are supported.
Target view identifier for this welcome content. Only tree based views are supported.

when.description: Condition when the welcome content should be displayed.

walkthroughs.description: Contribute walkthroughs to help users getting started with your extension.

featuredFor.description: Walkthroughs that match one of these glob patterns appear as 'featured' in workspaces with the specified files. For example, a walkthrough for TypeScript projects might specify `tsconfig.json` here.

icon.description: Relative path to the icon of the walkthrough. The path is relative to the extension location. If not specified, the icon defaults to the extension icon if available.

id.description: Unique identifier for this walkthrough.

steps.description: Steps to complete as part of this walkthrough.

button.deprecationMessage: Deprecated. Use markdown links in the description instead, i.e. [Title](command:myext.command), [Title](command:toSide:myext.command), or [Title](https://aka.ms)

completionEvents.description: Events that should trigger this step to become checked off. If empty or not defined, the step will check off when any of the step's buttons or links are clicked; if the step has no buttons or links it will check on when it is selected.

defaultSnippets.label: onCommand
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when a given command is executed anywhere in VS Code.

defaultSnippets.label: onLink
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when a given link is opened via a walkthrough step.

defaultSnippets.label: onView
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when a given view is opened

defaultSnippets.label: onSettingChanged
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when a given setting is changed

defaultSnippets.label: onContext
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when a context key expression is true.

defaultSnippets.label: onExtensionInstalled
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step when an extension with the given id is installed. If the extension is already installed, the step will start off checked.

defaultSnippets.label: onStepSelected
defaultSnippets.description: Check off step as soon as it is selected.

description.description: Description of step. Supports ``preformatted``, __italic__, and **bold** text. Use markdown-style links for commands or external links: [Title](command:myext.command), [Title](command:toSide:myext.command), or [Title](https://aka.ms). Links on their own line will be rendered as buttons.

doneOn.description: Signal to mark step as complete.
doneOn.deprecationMessage: doneOn is deprecated. By default steps will be checked off when their buttons are clicked, to configure further use completionEvents

command.description: Mark step done when the specified command is executed.

id.description: Unique identifier for this step. This is used to keep track of which steps have been completed.

media.description: Media to show alongside this step, either an image or markdown content.

image.description: Path to an image - or object consisting of paths to light, dark, and hc images - relative to extension directory. Depending on context, the image will be displayed from 400px to 800px wide, with similar bounds on height. To support HIDPI displays, the image will be rendered at 1.5x scaling, for example a 900 physical pixels wide image will be displayed as 600 logical pixels wide.

dark.description: Path to the image for dark themes, relative to extension directory.

hc.description: Path to the image for hc themes, relative to extension directory.

hcLight.description: Path to the image for hc light themes, relative to extension directory.

light.description: Path to the image for light themes, relative to extension directory.

markdown.description: Path to the markdown document, relative to extension directory.

svg.description: Path to an svg, color tokens are supported in variables to support theming to match the workbench.

when.description: Context key expression to control the visibility of this step.
Context key expression to control the visibility of this walkthrough.

displayName.description: The display name for the extension used in the VS Code gallery.

enabledApiProposals.markdownDescription: Enable API proposals to try them out. Only valid **during development**. Extensions **cannot be published** with this property. For more details visit: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/advanced-topics/using-proposed-api

vscode.description: For VS Code extensions, specifies the VS Code version that the extension is compatible with. Cannot be *. For example: ^0.10.5 indicates compatibility with a minimum VS Code version of 0.10.5.

extensionDependencies.description: Dependencies to other extensions. The identifier of an extension is always ${publisher}.${name}. For example: vscode.csharp.

extensionKind.description: Define the kind of an extension. `ui` extensions are installed and run on the local machine while `workspace` extensions run on the remote.

enumDescriptions: UI extension kind. In a remote window, such extensions are enabled only when available on the local machine.
Workspace extension kind. In a remote window, such extensions are enabled only when available on the remote.

defaultSnippets.description: Define an extension which can run only on the local machine when connected to remote window.
Define an extension which can run only on the remote machine when connected remote window.
Define an extension which can run on either side, with a preference towards running on the local machine.
Define an extension which can run on either side, with a preference towards running on the remote machine.
Define an extension which cannot run in a remote context, neither on the local, nor on the remote machine.

extensionPack.description: A set of extensions that can be installed together. The identifier of an extension is always ${publisher}.${name}. For example: vscode.csharp.

galleryBanner.description: Banner used in the VS Code marketplace.

color.description: The banner color on the VS Code marketplace page header.

theme.description: The color theme for the font used in the banner.

icon.description: The path to a 128x128 pixel icon.

l10n.description: The relative path to a folder containing localization (bundle.l10n.*.json) files. Must be specified if you are using the vscode.l10n API.

markdown.description: Controls the Markdown rendering engine used in the Marketplace. Either github (default) or standard.

preview.description: Sets the extension to be flagged as a Preview in the Marketplace.

pricing.markdownDescription: The pricing information for the extension. Can be Free (default) or Trial. For more details visit: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/working-with-extensions/publishing-extension#extension-pricing-label

publisher.description: The publisher of the VS Code extension.

qna.description: Controls the Q&A link in the Marketplace. Set to marketplace to enable the default Marketplace Q & A site. Set to a string to provide the URL of a custom Q & A site. Set to false to disable Q & A altogether.

vscode:prepublish.description: Script executed before the package is published as a VS Code extension.

vscode:uninstall.description: Uninstall hook for VS Code extension. Script that gets executed when the extension is completely uninstalled from VS Code which is when VS Code is restarted (shutdown and start) after the extension is uninstalled. Only Node scripts are supported.

sponsor.description: Specify the location from where users can sponsor your extension.

url.description: URL from where users can sponsor your extension. It must be a valid URL with a HTTP or HTTPS protocol. Example value: https://github.com/sponsors/nvaccess

id.markdownDescription: The identifier of the status bar entry. Must be unique within the extension. The same value must be used when calling the `vscode.window.createStatusBarItem(id, ...)`-API

name.description: The name of the entry, like 'Python Language Indicator', 'Git Status' etc. Try to keep the length of the name short, yet descriptive enough that users can understand what the status bar item is about.

text.description: The text to show for the entry. You can embed icons in the text by leveraging the `$(<name>)`-syntax, like 'Hello $(globe)!'

tooltip.description: The tooltip text for the entry.

command.description: The command to execute when the status bar entry is clicked.

alignment.description: The alignment of the status bar entry.

priority.description: The priority of the status bar entry. Higher value means the item should be shown more to the left.

accessibilityInformation.description: Defines the role and aria label to be used when the status bar entry is focused.

role.description: The role of the status bar entry which defines how a screen reader interacts with it. More about aria roles can be found here https://w3c.github.io/aria/#widget_roles

label.description: The aria label of the status bar entry. Defaults to the entry's text.

vendor.description: A globally unique vendor of language model chat provider.

displayName.description: The display name of the language model chat provider.

managementCommand.description: A command to manage the language model chat provider, e.g. 'Manage Copilot models'. This is used in the chat model picker. If not provided, a gear icon is not rendered during vendor selection.

_5.description: Icon path when a light theme is used

_6.description: Icon path when a dark theme is used

command.description: Identifier of the command to execute

title.description: Title by which the command is represented in the UI

shortTitle.markdownDescription: (Optional) Short title by which the command is represented in the UI. Menus pick either `title` or `shortTitle` depending on the context in which they show commands.

category.description: (Optional) Category string by which the command is grouped in the UI

enablement.description: (Optional) Condition which must be true to enable the command in the UI (menu and keybindings). Does not prevent executing the command by other means, like the `executeCommand`-api.

icon.description: (Optional) Icon which is used to represent the command in the UI. Either a file path, an object with file paths for dark and light themes, or a theme icon references, like "\$(zap)"

command.description: Identifier of the command to execute. The command must be declared in the 'commands'-section

alt.description: Identifier of an alternative command to execute. The command must be declared in the 'commands'-section

submenu.description: Identifier of the submenu to display in this item.

_11.markdownDescription: Proposed API, requires `enabledApiProposal: ["contribDiffEditorGutterToolBarMenus"]` - The gutter toolbar in the diff editor

title.description: A title for the current category of settings. This label will be rendered in the Settings editor as a subheading. If the title is the same as the extension display name, then the category will be grouped under the main extension heading.

order.description: When specified, gives the order of this category of settings relative to other categories.

enumDescriptions: Configuration that can be configured only in the user settings.
Configuration that can be configured only in the user settings or only in the remote settings.
Configuration that can be configured in the user, remote or workspace settings.
Configuration that can be configured in the user, remote, workspace or folder settings.
Resource configuration that can be configured in language specific settings.
Machine configuration that can be configured also in workspace or folder settings.
scope.markdownDescription: Scope in which the configuration is applicable. Available scopes are `application`, `machine`, `window`, `resource`, and `machine-overridable`.

markdownEnumDescriptions.description: Descriptions for enum values in the markdown format.

enumItemLabels.markdownDescription: Labels for enum values to be displayed in the Settings editor. When specified, the `enum` values still show after the labels, but less prominently.

markdownDescription.description: The description in the markdown format.

deprecationMessage.description: If set, the property is marked as deprecated and the given message is shown as an explanation.

markdownDeprecationMessage.description: If set, the property is marked as deprecated and the given message is shown as an explanation in the markdown format.

enumDescriptions: The value will be shown in an inputbox.
The value will be shown in a textarea.
editPresentation.description: When specified, controls the presentation format of the string setting.

order.description: When specified, gives the order of this setting relative to other settings within the same category. Settings with an order property will be placed before settings without this property set.

ignoreSync.description: When enabled, Settings Sync will not sync the user value of this configuration by default.

tags.markdownDescription: A list of categories under which to place the setting. The category can then be searched up in the Settings editor. For example, specifying the `experimental` tag allows one to find the setting by searching `@tag:experimental`.

id.description: Unique id used to identify the container in which views can be contributed using 'views' contribution point

title.description: Human readable string used to render the container

icon.description: Path to the container icon. Icons are 24x24 centered on a 50x40 block and have a fill color of 'rgb(215, 218, 224)' or '#d7dae0'. It is recommended that icons be in SVG, though any image file type is accepted.

type.markdownDescription: Type of the view. This can either be `tree` for a tree view based view or `webview` for a webview based view. The default is `tree`.
markdownEnumDescriptions: The view is backed by a `TreeView` created by `createTreeView`.
The view is backed by a `WebviewView` registered by `registerWebviewViewProvider`.

id.markdownDescription: Identifier of the view. This should be unique across all views. It is recommended to include your extension id as part of the view id. Use this to register a data provider through `vscode.window.registerTreeDataProviderForView` API. Also to trigger activating your extension by registering `onView:${id}` event to `activationEvents`.

icon.description: Path to the view icon. View icons are displayed when the name of the view cannot be shown. It is recommended that icons be in SVG, though any image file type is accepted.

contextualTitle.description: Human-readable context for when the view is moved out of its original location. By default, the view's container name will be used.

visibility.description: Initial state of the view when the extension is first installed. Once the user has changed the view state by collapsing, moving, or hiding the view, the initial state will not be used again.
enumDescriptions: The default initial state for the view. In most containers the view will be expanded, however; some built-in containers (explorer, scm, and debug) show all contributed views collapsed regardless of the `visibility`.
The view will not be shown in the view container, but will be discoverable through the views menu and other view entry points and can be un-hidden by the user.
The view will show in the view container, but will be collapsed.

initialSize.description: The initial size of the view. The size will behave like the css 'flex' property, and will set the initial size when the view is first shown. In the side bar, this is the height of the view. This value is only respected when the same extension owns both the view and the view container.

accessibilityHelpContent.markdownDescription: When the accessibility help dialog is invoked in this view, this content will be presented to the user as a markdown string. Keybindings will be resolved when provided in the format of <keybinding:commandId>. If there is no keybinding, that will be indicated and this command will be included in a quickpick for easy configuration.

_15.description: The human-readable name of the view. Will be shown

_16.description: Condition which must be true to show this view

command.description: Identifier of the command to run when keybinding is triggered.

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command to execute.

key.description: Key or key sequence (separate keys with plus-sign and sequences with space, e.g. Ctrl+O and Ctrl+L L for a chord).

mac.description: Mac specific key or key sequence.

linux.description: Linux specific key or key sequence.

win.description: Windows specific key or key sequence.

when.description: Condition when the key is active.

_19.markdownDeprecationMessage: Controls if the custom editor is enabled automatically when the user opens a file. This may be overridden by users using the `workbench.editorAssociations` setting.
markdownEnumDescriptions: The editor is automatically used when the user opens a resource, provided that no other default custom editors are registered for that resource.
The editor is not automatically used when the user opens a resource, but a user can switch to the editor using the `Reopen With` command.

name.description: Identifier for this file. Must be unique within this extension for this contribution point.

path.description: Path to the file relative to the extension root.

_21.description: Whether invoking the command puts the chat into a persistent mode, where the command is automatically added to the chat input for the next message.

_22.markdownDescription: A detailed name for this category, e.g. `workspace_questions` or `web_questions`.

_23.description: A short name by which this command is referred to in the UI, e.g. `fix` or `explain` for commands that fix an issue or explain code. The name should be unique among the commands provided by this participant.

_25.description: A condition which must be true to enable this command.

_26.description: A regular expression or string to test the command line against

_27.description: The regular expression to find an error, warning or info in the output.

_28.description: whether the pattern matches a location (file and line) or only a file.

_29.description: The match group index of the filename. If omitted 1 is used.

_30.description: The match group index of the problem's location. Valid location patterns are: (line), (line,column) and (startLine,startColumn,endLine,endColumn). If omitted (line,column) is assumed.

_31.description: The match group index of the problem's line. Defaults to 2

_32.description: The match group index of the problem's line character. Defaults to 3

_33.description: The match group index of the problem's end line. Defaults to undefined

_34.description: The match group index of the problem's end line character. Defaults to undefined

_35.description: The match group index of the problem's severity. Defaults to undefined

_36.description: The match group index of the problem's code. Defaults to undefined

_37.description: The match group index of the message. If omitted it defaults to 4 if location is specified. Otherwise it defaults to 5.

_38.description: In a multi line matcher loop indicated whether this pattern is executed in a loop as long as it matches. Can only specified on a last pattern in a multi line pattern.

regexp.description: The regular expression to detect the begin or end of a background task.

file.description: The match group index of the filename. Can be omitted.

_44.description: Alternate text to display when the image cannot be loaded or in screen readers.

_45.description: Condition which must be true to show this item.

_47.description: Condition which must be true to show this item

_48.description: Group into which this item belongs
